etymology.description: Phonetic: 卉(卉) (huì, 'plant') + Semantic: 貝(貝) (bèi, 'cowry') -> loaned for 奔(奔) (bēn, 'rush') -> used for 'decorate'
etymology.interpretation: Originally, 賁(bēn) used 貝(貝) ('cowry') symbolizing valuable decoration and paired with phonetic 卉(卉) ('plant'). It was borrowed early on to represent 奔(奔) ('rush'), diversifying its meaning.

examples.chinese: 他賁飾了院子(他賁飾了院子)，使之焕然一新(使之煥然一新)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bēn shì le yuànzi, shǐ zhī huànrán yī xīn.
examples.english: He decorated the courtyard, making it look completely renewed.

examples.chinese: 节日来临时(節日來臨時)，市集被彩灯賁耀(市集被彩燈賁耀)。
examples.pinyin: Jiérì láilín shí, shìjí bèi cǎidēng bēn yào.
examples.english: When the festival arrived, the market was brilliantly decorated with colorful lights.
